txt.en: 'The Golden Wood shall never fall to Sauron.'
'No more shall the Wargs harm Lothlórien and its inhabitants.'
You have finally arrived at Caras Galadhon.\n\nThe twins are waiting for you in Galadriel's Garden. You should talk to Elrohir.
'Chin up, Elladan. I'm sure [placeholder] would do us the honour of adventuring with us in the future!'
The twins have departed to complete their errand.\n\nLord Celeborn would like to speak with you.
DNT
'That must be the leader. A formidable beast, but mortal all the same.'
Talk to the injured sentinel
'Over here, [placeholder]!'
'You heard that too, didn't you?'
'Our travels were fraught with danger, but... a small part of me is sad that it's over.'
Find and help the scouts
DNT
'Your scheming ends here, abhorrent creature.'
The twins have returned with Lady Galadriel, who seems to have a few words for you.
'Alas, we are nearing journey's end.'
'What's this? Our next meals offer themselves up so willingly!'
'And it is his pack that will send you to your doom!'

'These are strange tidings.' The guard squints at you for a brief moment before sighing in defeat.

'You are a stranger to these lands and my people. But if the sons of Elrond trust you, then I shall put aside my misgivings.

'The Wargs came down from the Vales. Our scouts have reported that one -- grey and larger than the others -- commands the movements of the rest.

'Several Wargs ambushed us here before escaping to the south-east. Two scouts followed the fleeing Wargs and have not reported back. I fear that they may have been overwhelmed.'
'Rest now, [placeholder].'
'Don't worry. We'll find our answers and prepare for what's to come.'
'Take care.'
Talk to Elrohir
Talk to Celeborn
'I see more of them! Hold fast!'
'I did. Here they come!'
Talk to Galadriel
'Have you found my partner?'
'Yet the moment we reach our destination...'
'Hah! Sauron? We answer to none other than Ránulur, Chieftain of Wargs.'
The Wargs have wasted no time wreaking havoc in Lothlórien.
Walk with the twins
Find the Warg pack-leader
'Thank you. I'd join in your hunt, but in my state, I would only hinder you.'
DNT
'Not once have we come across servants of the Enemy in our travels.'
Mission: The Further Adventures of Elladan & Elrohir, Chapter 5
Confront the Warg pack-leader
'Grandfather!'
'We'll find her. I promise.'
'Be careful -- the grey Warg stalks Cerin Brethil with its brethren.'
Defeat the Wargs
DNT
Talk to Elladan

'[placeholder], there you are! Our grandmother's garden is a sight to behold, is it not? I can forgive you for wanting to linger and take it all in. Though, I must caution you against wandering too far. We have given our word that you are trustworthy; however, the Galadhrim do not look favourably upon strangers -- as I'm sure you've realized.\n\n'We must part ways to meet with our grandmother soon, but for now... shall we walk in together?' Elrohir smiles.
'We shall keep an eye out for them.'
'There's the other scout!'

'You have my gratitude for keeping my grandsons safe. I was told that the three of you passed through the Redhorn Gate to enter Lórien. The crossing must have been... difficult for them. Their mother has long since sailed West, but our grief remains.

'The details of what transpired during your travels elude me. What news from Imladris? Did you discover anything?'

As you recount every step of your travels, Lord Celeborn listens attentively. When you finish describing your encounters with the Wargs from Shathur-munzu, his expression darkens.

'I'm sure my grandsons told you of our family's connection to that cursed place. This Ránulur may not be a threat at the moment, but I believe his tale is not finished. Should he decide to endanger Lórien again, he will not find mercy.

'Please, wait here. I believe my wife would like to speak to you once her business with our grandsons is done.'
'Elladan, Elrohir. She's waiting for you.'
'You're right, Elrohir. Thank you.'
DNT

'While my grandsons' reasons for being here are grave, I am glad to see them again. May our next meeting be under happier circumstances.

'They came to me with heavy hearts after what happened on Caradhras. Do not fret, [placeholder] -- your presence steadied them. Such wounds may never heal completely, but they can be soothed. My Mirror showed them visions of the past, moments that they hold dear. Sometimes it is a kindness to remember.'

As Lady Galadriel speaks, she studies you with keen eyes that almost seem to pierce through you.

'The coming days will be dire ones for Middle-earth. I foresee that you have your own part to play in the shaping of its fate -- indeed, you have already taken your first steps. Our paths shall cross again.

'But do not let such thoughts occupy your mind for now. Find peace under the mellyrn. Once you have rested and regained your strength, we will send you on your way.'
'Indeed.'
'Welcome to Caras Galadhon. May we speak?'
'Watch out!'
'Then we shall cleanse their foul presence from that place.'

'These are strange tidings.' The guard squints at you for a brief moment before sighing in defeat.

'I do not know you. But if the sons of Elrond trust you, then I shall put aside my misgivings.

'The Wargs came down from the Vales. Our scouts have reported that one -- grey and larger than the others -- commands the movements of the rest.

'Several Wargs ambushed us here before escaping to the south-east. Two scouts followed the fleeing Wargs and have not reported back. I fear that they may have been overwhelmed.'
The second scout warned you that the Wargs' leader stalks Cerin Brethil.\n\nYou should find the remaining Wargs and their leader.

'These are strange tidings.' The guard squints at you for a brief moment before sighing in defeat.

'I am in no position to refuse help, regardless of the form it takes. If the sons of Elrond trust you, then I shall put aside my misgivings.

'The Wargs came down from the Vales. Our scouts have reported that one -- grey and larger than the others -- commands the movements of the rest.

'Several Wargs ambushed us here before escaping to the south-east. Two scouts followed the fleeing Wargs and have not reported back. I fear that they may have been overwhelmed.'

'These are strange tidings.' The guard squints at you for a brief moment before sighing in defeat.

'I do not recognize your kind. But if the sons of Elrond trust you, then I shall put aside my misgivings.

'The Wargs came down from the Vales. Our scouts have reported that one -- grey and larger than the others -- commands the movements of the rest.

'Several Wargs ambushed us here before escaping to the south-east. Two scouts followed the fleeing Wargs and have not reported back. I fear that they may have been overwhelmed.'

'These are strange tidings.' The guard squints at you for a brief moment before sighing in defeat.

'You are a stranger to these lands and my people. But if the sons of Elrond trust you, then I shall put aside my misgivings.

'The Wargs came down from the Vales. Our scouts have reported that one -- grey and larger than the others -- commands the movements of the rest.

'Several Wargs ambushed us here before escaping to the southeast. Two scouts followed the fleeing Wargs and have not reported back. I fear that they may have been overwhelmed.'
'I'm sorry, I cannot continue fighting... but please, find my partner.'
DNT
'One of the scouts, up ahead!'
'Yes. She must have returned to Talan Revail by now.'
You have found an injured Galadhrim sentinel at the base of Talan Revail.\n\nYou should talk to him to discover what happened.
'We couldn't have made it this far without you. We're in your debt.'
Two Galadhrim scouts followed the Wargs to the south-east but haven't reported back.\n\nYou should find and help them.
The twins will leave to meet with Lady Galadriel soon, but they have asked you to walk with them into the garden.
You have found the remaining Wargs and their leader.\n\nYou should confront them.
'Then this is farewell for now, [placeholder].'
'Even the wildlife is in danger...'
You should defeat the remaining Wargs and their leader.
'We'll follow your lead, [placeholder].'
The Wargs have been defeated. It seems they do not serve Sauron, but rather, a Warg called Ránulur.\n\nYou should talk to Elladan about what transpired.
'[placeholder], I would have a word with you.'
'We were separated in the skirmish. She pursued the Wargs south.'
Time passes as Elladan and Elrohir discuss matters with Lady Galadriel...

'The Warg mentioned a name -- Ránulur. I cannot imagine the \qChieftain of Wargs\q would allow another to command the pack unless he did not come with them. Now that we know they do not fight for Sauron, they are not a sizable threat. The remaining Wargs will either slink back to the Vales or fall to the Galadhrim. Lórien is safe.\n\n'Perhaps Shathur-munzu will not be such a dark place one day. But for now, we must turn our gaze elsewhere. We'll let the scouts at Talan Revail know that the Wargs are no more, then return to Caras Galadhon.'
